Issues.Title: fix(v-model): ensure v-model listener trigger before listener with modifier(fix #11925)
Issues.Body:
This reverts commit 62405aa9035d5f547c0440263f16f21c1325f100.

Because after v2.6.0, nextTick always use microtask.
There will be an update between 2 listener and block the v-model listener to update.
We need to ensure the listener of v-model is triggered before listener with modifier to fix #11925.

#### Before: https://jsfiddle.net/fxdez9qh/
#### After: https://jsfiddle.net/juniortour/ty7ps0kw/

Issues.Title: Update one of array will affect whole array
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.11

### Reproduction link
[https://codesandbox.io/s/exciting-resonance-g8oq2?file=/src/components/SchedulerItem.vue](https://codesandbox.io/s/exciting-resonance-g8oq2?file=/src/components/SchedulerItem.vue)







### Steps to reproduce
Mouse down the div that class name called top or bottom then move the mouse to trigger mouse move event.
After doing the procedure,  it will trigger the method called handleMove to update array, but it seems weird. It will update the whole array, even though I just update the index zero of array.

### What is expected?
Just update one of array.

### What is actually happening?
It will update the whole array.

Issues.Title: Passing dynamic values into subcomponents will not render correctly!
Issues.Body:
### Version 2.6.11 ### Reproduction link [https://codesandbox.io/s/fervent-austin-9zre8?file=/src/components/HelloWorld.vue](https://codesandbox.io/s/fervent-austin-9zre8?file=/src/components/HelloWorld.vue) ### Steps to reproduce I tried to write it according to the official document example, but when the dynamic attribute value is passed in, it will be rendered to the tag attribute of the subcomponent. I don't know what's wrong? This is the last example of the rendering list in the official document. The code is as follows: @/components/HelloWorld.vue ```
``` @/components/TodoItems.vue ``` ``` I review the DOM element and the rendering results are: ```
``` As you can see, the is property will render the todoitems component correctly, but the incoming text property will display correctly in the Li tag, not in the text! And the following error occurred in the console: > Property or method "text" is not defined on the instance but referenced during render. Make sure that this property is reactive, either in the data option, or for class-based components, by initializing the property. See: https://vuejs.org/v2/guide/reactivity.html#Declaring-Reactive-Properties. found in ---> at src/components/TodoItems.vue at src/components/HelloWorld.vue at src/views/Home.vue at src/App.vue When I test passing in attributes to other child components in other parent components, it will render correctly! But in this case, I don't know why? Miraculously, there is no problem in using JS. Please refer to the sandbox address I created When writing with TS, it is not expected. ### What is expected? The text attribute passed in can be correctly rendered under the Li tag ### What is actually happening? In this example, the rendering is not correct, even if the component is used instead of the is attribute, the rendering result is the same --- Looking forward to the solution
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Passing dynamic values into subcomponents will not render correctly!" (#11950)

Issues.Title: build(deps): bump handlebars from 4.4.3 to 4.7.7
Issues.Body:
Bumps [handlebars](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js) from 4.4.3 to 4.7.7.
Changelog

Sourced from handlebars's changelog.

v4.7.7 - February 15th, 2021

  • fix weird error in integration tests - eb860c0
  • fix: check prototype property access in strict-mode (#1736) - b6d3de7
  • fix: escape property names in compat mode (#1736) - f058970
  • refactor: In spec tests, use expectTemplate over equals and shouldThrow (#1683) - 77825f8
  • chore: start testing on Node.js 12 and 13 - 3789a30

(POSSIBLY) BREAKING CHANGES:

  • the changes from version 4.6.0 now also apply in when using the compile-option "strict: true". Access to prototype properties is forbidden completely by default, specific properties or methods can be allowed via runtime-options. See #1633 for details. If you are using Handlebars as documented, you should not be accessing prototype properties from your template anyway, so the changes should not be a problem for you. Only the use of undocumented features can break your build.

That is why we only bump the patch version despite mentioning breaking changes.

Commits

v4.7.6 - April 3rd, 2020

Chore/Housekeeping:

  • #1672 - Switch cmd parser to latest minimist (@​dougwilson

Compatibility notes:

  • Restored Node.js compatibility

Commits

v4.7.5 - April 2nd, 2020

Chore/Housekeeping:

  • Node.js version support has been changed to v6+ Reverted in 4.7.6

Compatibility notes:

  • Node.js < v6 is no longer supported Reverted in 4.7.6

Commits

v4.7.4 - April 1st, 2020

Chore/Housekeeping:

  • #1666 - Replaced minimist with yargs for handlebars CLI (@​aorinevo, @​AviVahl & @​fabb)

Compatibility notes:

... (truncated)

Commits
  • a9a8e40 v4.7.7
  • e66aed5 Update release notes
  • 7d4d170 disable IE in Saucelabs tests
  • eb860c0 fix weird error in integration tests
  • b6d3de7 fix: check prototype property access in strict-mode (#1736)
  • f058970 fix: escape property names in compat mode (#1736)
  • 77825f8 refator: In spec tests, use expectTemplate over equals and shouldThrow (#1683)
  • 3789a30 chore: start testing on Node.js 12 and 13
  • e6ad93e v4.7.6
  • 2bf4fc6 Update release notes
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

Issues.Title: Mixin without template/render fn results in warning(s)
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.11

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/ndresx/vuejs-mixin-no-template-warn](https://github.com/ndresx/vuejs-mixin-no-template-warn)







### Steps to reproduce
1. `npm run serve` (app starts normally without any warnings being shown)
2. Change `Mixin.vue` (e.g., change the console.log message)
3. Warning gets shown `"[Vue warn]: Failed to mount component: template or render function not defined."` on every change

### What is expected?
No warnings about failed mounting attempts as it seems to be workings without a template or render function. Also, the mixin-related examples in the official documentation don't use templates, so there shouldn't be a warning like this at all. Otherwise, it should be already shown when the app gets bootstrapped and not only on subsequent file changes.

### What is actually happening?
I'm not sure, but this behavior and warning logs seem to be inconsistent with this error message. It should be either shown all the time or never.

_Edit: Renaming the mixin's file extension to `.js/.ts` (instead of `.vue`) has solved the issue, and the warning doesn't get shown anymore. However, it's still confusing, in my opinion, that it doesn't get logged right away and only after a change since the mixin's functionality doesn't seem to be directly affected by this._

_It might be worth also adding a note about this to the documentation unless I have missed it._

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: Dep collection not paused during first invocation of immediate watchers, leading to unnecessary re-render
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.11

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/gyejmL14/32/](https://jsfiddle.net/gyejmL14/32/)

### Steps to reproduce
Press the button "change value of testKey".

### What is expected?
No components should be updated

### What is actually happening?
The root components render function is being run again.

During component-a's creation, the immediate watcher for testKey is invoked without a pushTarget(). At this point the updateComponent() of the parent is still the Dep.target. Everything accessed within the immediate watcher is then collected as a dependency of the parents updateComponent watcher. When the button is then pressed, this triggers an unnecessary update of the Root component.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Dep collection not paused during first invocation of immediate watchers, leading to unnecessary re-render" (#11942)

Issues.Title: Using provide and inject in components from local file system
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.12

### Reproduction link
[https://gitlab.com/rm-issues/vue-external-components-provide-inject](https://gitlab.com/rm-issues/vue-external-components-provide-inject)







### Steps to reproduce
Use a parent component and Child component from a folder in your local file system that is not in your current project folder.

This would be the case e.g. for testing reusable components located in their own project folder and wanting to debug them.

In the Repo this is already present. To reproduce there

npm install in project root folder
npm install in src/external-folder (representing an external vue project somewhere on your file system)
npm run serve

### What is expected?
EP_foo (provided variable in external module) should be provided and injected to it's child component just like it's the case with P_foo (provided variable in the project internal component)

### What is actually happening?
While the providing and injecting works just fine with components in the project. in projects that are imported from somewhere else on the drive the injected variable is not found in the child component.

### Additional Comments

Debugging *vues src/core/instance/inject.ts* it seems like the external child components parent derived from vm.$options.source.$parent points to the external components root app instead of the parent used in the app. However if the childs parent is determined by vm.$options.vm.$parent the correct parent with the data seems to be present. Now I'm not too familiar with vue.js' source code and using ...vm.$parent might come with other implications but I just wanted to point out the finding

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Using provide and inject in components from local file system" (#11938)

Issues.Title: Vue2 - Using provide and inject in components from local file system
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.12

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/egbhs3pt/](https://jsfiddle.net/egbhs3pt/)







### Steps to reproduce
Use a parent component and Child component from a folder in your local file system that is not in your current project folder.

This would be the case e.g. for testing reusable components located in their own project folder and wanting to debug them

### What is expected?
Injected should be filled properly

### What is actually happening?
While the provided function seems to run as it should inject in the child component will fail with "Injection "my_injection" not found"

so while the same component will work with

import { MyComponent } from "my-new-component"

will work (like in the fiddle)

import { MyComponent } from "../../my-new-component"

will fail

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: Called without include/exclude when a kept-alive component is deactivated
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?

Scene:
There are two lists A and B in the menu O.

List A and List B should be cached, A and B are the same components, and key is used to distinguish caching.

List A goes to detail A, detail A does not need to be cached, list A and detail A use include/exclude to match(exclude: detail A component name).

From detail A to list B, now detail A and list A are cached, and detail A that do not need to be cached are cached together.

场景：
O菜单中有A、B两个列表，
A、B列表要缓存，A、B相同组件，用key区别缓存
A列表进入a详情，a详情不需要缓存，A列表、a详情使用include、exclude匹配过滤
此时从a详情进入B列表，A列表中的全被缓存了，把不需要缓存的a详情页一起缓存了


### What does the proposed API look like?
Called with include/exclude when a kept-alive component is deactivated

被 keep-alive 缓存的组件停用时调用匹配include/exclude

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Called without include/exclude when a kept-alive component is deactivated" (#11934)

Issues.Title: v-for adding a range is not working anymore. how to do this?

Issues.Title: [Feaure Request] Reload component when navigating among pages rendered by a same component
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Suppose there is a route:
```
{
      path: '/user/:id',
      name: 'userHome',
      component: () => import('./views/user/Home'),
      props: true
    },
```
When navigating from page '/user/1' to page '/user/2', the page is not updated for the rendering component is the same and vue router will not reload it.

### What does the proposed API look like?
Reload the component when any of the route's params changed.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Feaure Request] Reload component when navigating among pages rendered by a same component" (#3479)

Issues.Title: android webview中使用loadDataWithBaseURL打开首页，打开页面后，不能回退到首页。同样的代码，浏览器中正常
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.5.1

### Reproduction link
[http://jsfiddle/无](http://jsfiddle/无)







### Steps to reproduce
1、android webview中使用loadDataWithBaseURL打开首页index.html，router采用hash模式；
2、在首页index.html的created函数中，使用router.push打开一个页面A，OK；
3、在A中，点击按钮后，使用router.push打开一个页面B，在B中点击按钮，调用router.back或go(-1)，无法返回，提示Not allowed to navigate top frame to data URL: data:text/html;charset=utf-8;charset=utf-8;base64,#/；
4、如果使用history模式，返回后呈现空白页。
试过再加一重跳转，index.html->A->B->C，都无法返回，日志提示是一样的。
### What is expected?
返回页面A

### What is actually happening?
页面无变化，日志中提示Not allowed to navigate top frame to data URL: data:text/html;charset=utf-8;charset=utf-8;base64,#/；
source: http://app.njhx.com/assets/builtin/vue-router-src_3.5.1.js (1994)
应该是这一行，window.location[replace ? 'replace' : 'assign'](url);

---
我猜测可能因为loadDataWithBaseURL，index.html是data url，所以不能返回，
但是进入index.html后，就立刻router.push(A)了，按理在B中调用router.back()时，应该回到A才对。

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "android webview中使用loadDataWithBaseURL打开首页，打开页面后，不能回退到首页。同样的代码，浏览器中正常" (#3471)

Issues.Title: There needs to be a way to disable scroll savedPosition
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
There needs to be a way to disable scroll savedPosition

It causes a style recalc and is slowing our app down (we see its the cause in profiler)

We dont use this feature and it seems like something that should be optional

### What does the proposed API look like?
Router init option
```
{
  saveScrollPosition: false, // or similar
}
```

Issues.Title: Add 'active' and 'exact-active' events to ( router-link ) component
Issues.Body:
<!--
IMPORTANT: Please use the following link to create a new issue:

  https://new-issue.vuejs.org/?repo=vuejs/vue-router

If your issue was not created using the app above, it will be closed immediately.
-->
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
I want to change position of ( link pointer ) to position of exact match link element 
```vue
<template lang="pug">
    div.menu
        Logo.menu__logo( :full='true' )
        ul.menu__list
          template( v-for='(path, localeKey) in links' )
            li.menu__item( @mouseleave='hoverdLink = null' @mouseover='hoverdLink = $event.target' )
              router-link.menu__link( :to=' `#${path.slice(1)}` ' ) {{ $t(`links.${localeKey}`) }}
          span.menu__pointer( ref='pointer' )
</template>
<script>
export default {
  data () {
    return {
      hoverdLink: null,
      activeLink: null,
      links: { ... }
    }
  },
  watch: {
    hoverdLink (hoverdLink) {
      const setWidth = (width) => { this.$refs.pointer.style.width = width + 'px' }
      const setPosition = (position) => { this.$refs.pointer.style.left = position + 'px' }
      if (!hoverdLink) {
        setWidth(0)
      } else {
        setWidth(hoverdLink.getBoundingClientRect().width)
        setPosition(hoverdLink.offsetLeft)
      }
    }
  }
}
</script>
```

<!-- A clear and concise description of what the problem is. Ex. I'm always frustrated when [...] -->

### Describe the solution you'd like
So i want to add an listener to 'active' event or 'exact-active' event to make it
```vue
<template lang="pug">
    div.menu
        Logo.menu__logo( :full='true' )
        ul.menu__list
          template( v-for='(path, localeKey) in links' )
            li.menu__item( @mouseleave='hoverdLink = null' @mouseover='hoverdLink = $event.target' )
              router-link.menu__link( :to=' `#${path.slice(1)}` '  @exact-active='activeLink = $event.target' ) {{ $t(`links.${localeKey}`) }}
          span.menu__pointer( ref='pointer' :class='{ "menu__pointer--active" : !!activeLink }' )
</template>
<script>
export default {
  data () {
    return {
      hoverdLink: null,
      activeLink: null,
      links: { ... }
    }
  },
 watch: {
    hoverdLink (hoverdLink) {
      // don't move pointer
      if ( this.activeLink ) return
      const setWidth = (width) => { this.$refs.pointer.style.width = width + 'px' }
      const setPosition = (position) => { this.$refs.pointer.style.left = position + 'px' }
      if (!hoverdLink) {
        setWidth(0)
      } else {
        setWidth(hoverdLink.getBoundingClientRect().width)
        setPosition(hoverdLink.offsetLeft)
      }
    }
  }
}
</script>
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Add 'active' and 'exact-active' events to ( router-link ) component" (#3468)

Issues.Title: Is possible to intercept the dispatcher?
Issues.Body:
In my project currently I have around of 400 dispatch and I saw that the big part of that implementation has the same code: 

```
this.$store.dispatch('action', this.payload).catch(e => {
   console.log(e)
    this.$notify.error(e.message)
})
```

So in order to reduce that code I'd like to intercept the dispatcher to throw the error once, and remove the extra code but I'm not sure if it's possible to do that. So just let me know if it's possible or there any other way to do it.

Thanks in advance.

Issues.Title: Private Mutations
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
I am faced with the problem that I have a change in state that might cause that state to become inconsistent. Let's say I have a city name and a zip code in my state. I do not want to change the zip code if the city is not within the area of that zip code. If I do that in a mutation I have no way to reject that change or to catch an error. However if I do it in an action I still need a mutation since actions cannot modify the state directly. Now my colleague is new to our huge project and doesn't notice that one must use the action instead of the mutation and causes the state to become inconsistent. Hence I propose mutations that may only be called from an action. This would enable developers to restrict changes in state to only non-breaking changes.

### What does the proposed API look like?
Since I use TypeScript the obvious way to do it seems a decorator. However to maintain consistency with the api and to be pure js compatible one might introduce a whole different category (e.g. "setters"). If backward compatibility were not an issue this may also become the default behavior as use-cases for mutations directly in components are rare anyhow, since most data needs validation. 
![Infographic from the official documentation](https://vuex.vuejs.org/vuex.png)

This infographic at  seems to imply this also. However these are just proposals off the top of my head and any implementation would need careful consideration as they would deeply impact the vuex api.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: Expose storeKey for unit test mocking when using useStore
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
When unit testing Composition API style components, the developer may want to mock the Vuex store for testing purposes. However, due to the Vue instance not being available at setup() time, the useStore method is used in place of this.$store. This requires the developer to inject their Vuex mock, rather than using the traditional instance mocking option of the vue-test-utils mount function. Provide/inject requires a key, which, unlike $store, is not visible to the end user.

### What does the proposed API look like?
Export the default storeKey. For devs who use the default storeKey rather than providing a custom key on plugin installation, this will provide a more durable testing solution. While the key is currently the string "store", this could change in the future, leaving end users with unexpected failing tests. Vue-router has similarly exported their provide keys. I'm willing to create a PR for this.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: Immutable references state properties should NOT warn of `do not mutate vuex store state outside mutation handlers.`
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
In a lot of contexts, we want to store _reference_ of objects in the store that come from a _library_. 
This means that the reference come from _outside_ the store and is managed (mutated) outside of the store too.

Vuex will by default, rightfully throw a warning because the object is mutated oustide of the store mutations.
However in some cases it is useful to store such references in the stores as _immutable references_, in order to persists them and to use them through getters and actions.
The warning should _not_ be thrown IF and only IF the reference is Immutable. The only known way of ensuring this is to wrap the reference with this Type: 
```Typescript
type Immutable<T> = {
  readonly [K in keyof T]: Immutable<T[K]>;
};
```

for example the state could have a [tiptap](https://github.com/ueberdosis/tiptap) Editor reference:
```Typescript 
editor!: Immutable<Editor> = getTipTapEditorInstance();
```

Where the Editor properties setting is managed by the library.
Which is a much needed pattern.


### What does the proposed API look like?
Vuex needs either to propose an Annotation that we would put above the immutable reference declaration in order to silence the warning *just* for this reference.
OR to detect at runtime to not throw the warning if all keys of the object are immutable/const
OR to detect if the reference is wrapped by the type Immutable<T>, type which could be provided by Vuex or even Vue.ts because it is generally useful

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: Best Practice: Should we throw errors in getters if the state is undefined?
Issues.Body:
Quite often we are handling situations that require an optional state. 

E.g., my state might look like this

```
export type State = {
  isAuthenticated: boolean
  account?: Account
}
```

The initial state will always be initialized with `isAuthenticated: false`. However, we assume that account will always be set in case a user logs in to our system. The user gets fetched during the login process.

At the moment, we are writing getters in a very simple an lean way, e.G.

```
  getAccount(state: State): Account | undefined
```

However, this approach would require us to either check if the return value of getAccount is `Account` or `undefined` in our consuming components, or we would need to use type assertion ( `const account = store.getters.getAccount as Account` ) which I think is a very bad practice.

My current approach would validate inside the getter if  the state is set and throw an error if it isn't, e.g.:

```
getAccount: (state) => {
  if(!state.account) {
    throw new Error("Account isn't set")
  }
  return state.account
}
```

Which would enable me to globally catch errors that occurre in getters rather than handling it in every single component.

What are the best practices of handling optional state in getters? Am I going down the wrong path?

Thank you
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Best Practice: Should we throw errors in getters if the state is undefined? " (#1923)

Issues.Title: ShoppingCart.vue : incorrect usage of :key attribute
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
This following correction will help developers better understand your example and eliminates confusion.

### What does the proposed API look like?
Line 6 to 8 of `ShoppingCart.vue` file is :

```
      <li
        v-for="product in products"
        :key="product.id">
```

but since `product.id` is undefined in result of computed getters `cartProducts` the `:key` attribute should be dropped. Code should simply be written:

```
      <li
        v-for="product in products">
```
